description:
Beard and mustache transplant is advised to people whose beard or mustache are thin or who suffer from lack of density due to various reasons. Today, voluminous and healthy looking beards are as important as healthy hair. Problems can be seen in the social life of men who can not get the image they want in their beards. Beard and mustache transplant is becoming more and more preferred and giving satisfying results thanks to developing hair transplantation technologies.

Why does beard and mustache fall or get thinner?

There may be many reasons for beard and mustache loss. Some of those;

  • Hormonal disorders
  • Accidents and burns
  • Damage to the skin as a result of laser hair removal
  • Ringworm. The disease, which is known in the medical literature as Alopecia Areata, can be seen not only in the hair but also in the eyebrows, beard, mustache and other parts of the body.
  • Hair pulling disorder, which is referred to as trichotillomania in the medical literature. There is a possibility that the pulled eyebrows will not grow again.

Genes are the main reasons why beards and mustaches are getting thinner. The density of beards and mustaches originate from genes.

Who can have Beard and Mustache Transplant?

Every man who has completed his developmental age, a good general health condition, lost his beard and mustache for various reasons and enough donor area can have a beard and mustache transplant.

In some cases beard and mustache transplant is not recommended to cardiac, diabetic and high blood pressure patients.

Things to consider before beard and mustache transplant

All medicines used must be reported to the clinic where beard and mustache will be transplanted. Clinical check-up, blood test is performed by the clinic. Use of alcohol should be stopped 1 week before the procedure. If a blood thinner is used, it should be discontinued 2 weeks before the procedure. Shirt-style clothing is mandatory on the day of the procedure. Before the operation, the body should rest with a sleep of at least 8 hours and a good breakfast should be had 2 hours before the operation.

Beard and Mustache Transplant with FUE method

Before starting to the beard and mustache transplantation, a planning is made and it is determined how many grafts will be extracted and at which angles the beard will be transplanted.

When beard and mustache transplantation is performed with FUE method, hair roots are taken from the region called donor region. Retrieved hair roots are transferred to the beard and mustache area. Although FUE method is the most widely used hair transplantation method today, it is also the most suitable planting method for beard and mustache transplantation. The hair follicles suitable for your beard and mustache can be easily selected and removed from the donor area.

Before the procedure, an experienced specialist determines how many grafts are going to be planted and at which angles, calculates the beard density according to the volume of the hair and determines the areas where the grafts will be transplanted in the beard.

When the root extraction process is started, the hair roots which are healthy and compatible with the beard and mustache area are taken individually by a micromotor. The collected hair follicles are kept in a special solution to prevent from damaging.

The extracted grafts are inserted into the transplant area anesthesized with local anesthesia by opening channels. The process is completed after all the grafts are inserted. The process takes of 3-6 hours in total.

Things to consider after beard and mustache transplant

The process after beard and mustache transplant directly affects the success of the operation. Beard and mustache transplant is a more sensitive operation than hair transplant, since it is done on facial area. Because the face area is more sensitive than the hair area, the healing process takes longer, but with simple measures and points to take into consideration, the process can be easily circumvented.

The first week after the transplantation, the transplanted area should be protected from impacts and sunlight. If any medication has been given to the patient, those medications should be used regularly. And use of blood thinners should be avoided. The channels opened during beard and mustache transplant create some scabs on the face. These scabs are cleaned one week after the operation with wash up procedures and creams.

Heavy sports should be avoided in the first month, and the patient should not stay under the sun for a long time. Turkish baths are not allowed for the first 3 months.

Beards should not be shaved during the elongation process. It can be shaved with a razor, machine or scissors 6 months after the operation.

Follow the instructions given by your clinic to provide a comfortable healing process.

description:
Eyebrow transplant is an operation done to restore the eyebrows that have been thin from the birth or have fallen or thinned because of various reasons. Eyebrows can get thinner or fall over time due to illness, drug use, genetic factors. Thinning and loss of eyebrows, which plays an important role in facial aesthetics and gestures that we use to express our thoughts, can cause aesthetic anxiety and psychological problems. Eyebrow transplant is a challenging operation but it gives successful results in experienced hands.

Why our eyebrows fall?

Eyebrows can get thinner or fall due to many reasons. Some of those:

  • Plucking eyebrows regularly is one of the biggest causes of eyebrow loss. This procedure, which is done to shape eyebrows may cause permanent eyebrow loss.
  • Ringworm may cause eyebrow loss. This disease, known in the medical literature as Alopecia Areata, can be seen not only in the hair but also in the eyebrows, beards, mustaches and other parts of the body.
  • Makeup, which is done to shape eyebrows, can cause eyebrows to fall.
  • Hair-pulling disorder, known as trichotillomania in the medical literature, may cause eyebrow loss.
  • Inadequate nutrition may affect hair and eyebrows. Lack of vitamins, minerals and iron can cause eyebrow loss.
  • Burns, accidents, traumas can cause eyebrow loss.
  • Goiter, atopic dermatitis which is a type of eczema, and similar diseases can cause eyebrow loss.
  • The use of certain medications can cause eyebrow loss.

Who can have eyebrow transplant?

Every man and woman who has completed his / her developmental period, who has a good general health condition, who has lost eyebrows due to various reasons and who has sufficient donor area, can have eyebrow transplant. In some cases, eyebrow transplantation is not recommended to the cardiac, diabetic and high blood pressure patients.

Pre-operation instructions for eyebrow transplant

All medications used should be reported to the clinic where eyebrow transplant will be performed. Health control and blood tests are performed by the clinic. Use of alcohol should be stopped 1 week before the procedure. If the patient is using any blood thinner, she/he should stop using it 2 weeks before the operation. Patient should wear front-buttoned or zippered top wear on the day of the procedure. The body should be rested with a sleep of at least 8 hours and the patient should have a good breakfast 2 hours before the operation.

Eyebrow Transplant with FUE method

During eyebrow transplant with FUE method, grafts are taken from the donor area, which is back side of the head. The grafts are transferred to the eyebrow area. FUE method is the most widely used hair transplant method today, and it is also the most suitable transplanting method for eyebrow transplant. With FUE method the grafts that are suitable for your eyebrows can be easily removed from the donor area by selecting.

Before the procedure, an experienced eyebrow transplant specialist determines in what angles eyebrows will be transplanted, estimates the density of the eyebrow according to the volume of the hair and determines the eyebrow area.

The process of taking the grafts is started and during this process the grafts which are healthy and compatible with the eyebrows, are taken individually by a micromotor. The taken grafts are kept in a special solution to prevent them from being damaged.

The taken grafts are placed to the transplant area which is anesthetized with local anesthesia, by opening channels. Once the grafts are placed, the process is completed. The process takes 2-3 hours in total.

Post-operation instructions for eyebrow transplant

Transplanted area should be protected from impacts and sunlight in the first week after eyebrow transplant. If any medication has been given to the patient, the use of medications should be regular and the use of blood thinners should be avoided.

The transplanted eyebrows start to grow on the 3rd month and complete their growth and take their final form in maximum 1 year. At the beginning, because of the different growth rate of the transplanted roots, transplanted hairs may grow faster than normal eyebrows. In these cases, eyebrows can be fixed. The transplanted eyebrows adapt to their place over time and after 1 year the rate of growth returns to normal.

treatments: Treatment for Female Pattern Hair Loss

description:
Hair Transplantation is a procedure to restore fallen hair due to various reasons. With the development of the technology and techniques used in practice, its popularity has increased all over the world. The loss of 80-100 hairs per day is considered normal. This amount may increase in some periods. If the amount of hair that a person sheds contstantly increases, thinning of the hair starts, and a while later, spaces starts to be visible.

Why do we lose hair?

Millions of people around the world suffer from hair loss. There are many reasons for this hairloss. Hair may fall out sudddenly or slowly. Genetics, disease, medications, sudden weight changes and pregnancy can cause hair loss. Hair loss is mostly due to genetic reasons. It is mostly seen in men but also as well as women. In genetic hair loss, hair follicles weaken and the shedding begins.The hairline is pulled backwards and/or aperture begins in the top region. After the weakening hair roots are shed, the hair does not grow again. Some diseases, such as thyroid and anemia, can cause hair loss. Treatment of these diseases usually stops hair loss and the patient may regain hair. Although cancer treatments such as chemotherapy causes hair loss, this is usually temporary. Hormonal changes such as pregnancy and menopause and stress can lead to hair loss. Hair loss is usually temporary in hormonal changes, but in stress-related situations, hair loss can be permanent. Malnutrition and the use of certain medications can also lead to temporary and permanent hair loss.

Who can have hair transplantation?

Every man and woman who has completed his/her developmental age, a good general health condition, lost his/her hairs for various reasons and enough donor area can have a hair transplant. In some cases, hair transplant is not recommended to cardiac, diabetic and high blood pressure patients.

Planning in hair transplantation

Hair transplantation planning is vital to the success of the procedure. Good planning ensures that the transplanted hair has a natural appearance. When a hair transplant operation is being planned, factors such as the reason of the hair loss, the structure of the hair, the extent of the hair loss, the condition of the donor area and the condition of the recipient area are considered. In which regions, how much hair is transplanted and how many sessions are required are determined during planning.

Things to consider before hair transplantation

For a successful and comfortable hair transplantation process, some issues should be considered before hair transplantation. All medicines used should be reported to the clinic where hair transplantation will be performed. Clinical check-up, blood test is performed by the clinic. Use of alcohol should be stopped 1 week before the procedure. If the patient is using any blood thinner, it should be discontinued 2 weeks before the procedure. Shirt-style clothing is mandatory on the day of the procedure. Before the operation, the body should be rested with a sleep of at least 8 hours and a good breakfast should be had 2 hours before the operation.

Hair Transplantation with FUE method

When hair transplantation is done, hair roots are taken from the region called donor area. The hair follicles are transplanted to the balding area. FUE method is the most widely used hair transplantation method today. In oppose to FUT technique, it provides denser transplanted area and healthier extracted hair follicles from the donor area.

Post operation instructions after a hair transplantation

The transplanted area should be protected from the sun or any bumping in the first week. The patient should use his medications regularly if any medication is given, and he should avoid to use blood thinners. After 7 to 10 days the hair can be washed by rubbing gently with fingertips. In the first month, hard exercices, tanning, swimming, Sauna are prohibited. Turk hammam is not allowed in the first 3 months. After second or the fourth week, the donor area can be shaved with a machine. For the first six months only scissors can be used for the transplanted area. Please follow the instructions given by your hair transplant clinic.

FUE yöntemi ile Saç Ekimi

Saç ekimi yapýlýrken donör bölge adý verilen bölgeden saç kökleri alýnýr. Alýnan saç kökleri saçsýz bölgeye nakledilir. FUE yöntemi günümüzde en çok kullanýlan saç ekim yöntemidir. FUT tekniðine göre donör bölgeden daha fazla ve daha saðlýklý saç kökleri alýnmasýný saðlar. Ýþlem öncesinde saç ekimine uygun þekilde hastanýn saçlarý kesilir ve doðal saç çizgisi belirlenir. Donör bölge ve ekim bölgesi lokal anestezi ile uyuþturulur. Kök toplama iþlemine geçildiðinde mikro motor ile saðlýklý saç kökleri tek tek alýnýr. Alýnan her saç kökünde 1 ila 4 arasýnda saç kýlý bulunur. Toplanan saç kökleri zarar görmemesi için özel bir solüsyonda bekletilir. Lokal anestezi ile uyuþturulmuþ ekim bölgesine tek tek kanallar açýlýr. Açýlan kanallara saç kökleri yerleþtirilir. Kökler yerleþtirildikten sonra iþlem tamamlanmýþ olur.

Saç Ekimi sonrasý dikkat edilmesi gerekenler

Saç ekimi sonrasý ilk hafta ekim yapýlan bölge darbelerden ve güneþ ýþýðýndan korunmalýdýr. Eðer hastaya ilaç verildiyse ilaç kullanýmý düzenli olmalýdýr ve kan sulandýrýcý ilaç kullanýmýndan kaçýnýlmalýdýr. 7 ila 10. günden sonra saçlar parmak uçlarýyla hafifçe ovalanarak yýkanabilir. Ýlk ay geçtikten sonra saçlar normal bir þekilde yýkanabilir. Ýlk ay aðýr sporlardan kaçýnýlmalýdýr, güneþ altýnda uzun süre kalýnmamalýdýr. Ýlk 3 ay hamama gidilmemelidir. 2. ya da 4. Haftadan itibaren donör bölge makine ile týraþ edilebilir. Ekim bölgesi ise ilk 6 ay boyunca yalnýzca makas ile kýsaltýlmalýdýr. Saç ekim kliniðinin verdiði talimatlara uyulmasý konforlu bir iyileþme süreci saðlar.

description:
PRP Hair treatment is an effective solution for people with hair loss and hair thinning problems. PRP (Platelet Rich Plasma) is prepared from the person's own blood and does not contain any other substance. The serum is prepared by separating the blood by special filters and centrifuge devices.

Platelets stop bleeding by forming a clot when there is an injury to the human body. It also contains growth factors that contribute to tissue repair and regeneration. PRP serum injected into the scalp area strengthens the scalp and hair and supports stem cells.

In which situations is PRP Hair Treatment preferred?

  • In order to slower hair loss and thinning in case of genetic hair loss
  • As a supportive treatment in hair transplant operations
  • In the solution of dandruff and oily hair problem
  • Thinning of hair seen in women

Advantages of PRP Hair Treatment

  • Since PRP is made from the person's own blood, there are no side effects.
  • It is a practical, safe treatment with long-term results.
  • Restores the strength of thinning hair.
  • When applied after hair transplantation, it strengthens the hair roots and nourishes the skin.

How is PRP Hair Treatment done?

PRP hair treatment is done in two stages. In the first stage, 10-20 ml blood is taken from the patient. The collected blood is processed in special centrifuge machines for 15 minutes. When the centrifuge is finished, platelet-rich plasma is separated from the blood.

In the second stage, PRP serum is injected to the scalp. Micro needles are used during the procedure.

When does the treatment result and how long does it last?

The effects of PRP hair treatment begin to manifest after treatment. The number of sessions required depends on the reaction of the hair to the treatment.

The duration of action varies between individuals, but the average duration is between 12 and 18 months.

description:
Scalp Micropigmentation is a non-surgical procedure for baldness. Epidermal micropigmentation with special devices is applied to mimic hair follicles. Specially produced organic dyes are applied for Scalp Micropigmentation. It can be applied for men and women.

Scalp Micropigmentation is not a hair transplantation method, but a cosmetic camouflage process. Helps the hair to look denser and thicker. After the Scalp Micropigmentation, one can return to his / her daily life.

In which situations is Scalp Micropigmentation preferred?

  • Hair transplantation can be used as a complementary method if the person cannot reach a fuller appearance in their hair after hair transplantation.
  • It can be applied for a more frequent appearance in people with hair loss and not enough donor area for hair transplantation.
  • There is scarring in the donor areas of people who had hair transplantation by FUT technique. Scalp Micropigmentation may be preferred to cover the scar.

What are the advantages of Scalp Micropigmentation?

  • Scalp Micropigmentation is not a surgical procedure. Therefore, the recovery time is short and the risk of infection is low.
  • Immediate results can be obtained after the procedure.
  • It can be applied in all kinds of hair loss cases.
  • Hair transplantation can still be done after Scalp Micropigmentation.

How long is the hair simulation?

The average life of Scalp Micropigmentation is 3-5 years. This period may vary according to the skin structure of the person. For example, in a very oily skin structure, this period may be reduced, while in dry skin it may be longer.

Who cannot have hair simulation?

Scalp Micropigmentation is not applied to cancer, anemia and AIDS patients and pregnant women.

Considerations after hair simulation

  • The treatment area should not come into contact with water for the first 24 hours. On the 2nd or 3rd day, you can take a shower with warm water without using any chemical shampoo.
  • The solarium and sauna should be avoided in the first month and the treatment area should be protected from the sun.

Saç simülasyonu kimlere uygulanmaz?

Saç simülasyonu, kanser hastalarýna, anemi hastalarýna, AIDS hastalýðý taþýyanlara ve hamilelere uygulanmaz.

description:
Some areas of the human body are more favorable to fat storage. With an adequate and balanced nutrition program and regular exercise, it is possible to dissolve the fat accumulated in the body tissues in general. However, it may be very difficult to get rid of regional weight because of some stubborn fat masses. Localized slimming methods such as needle lipolysis, laser lipolysis, cold lipolysis and liposuction can be used to avoid stubborn fat. These slimming methods aim to remove the stubborn fat cells from the area by breaking down, shrinking or melting.

What is Lipolysis?

It helps to get rid of the fats accumulated in body and face without needing surgery. Phosphatidyl choline derived from soy lecithin is used. Phosphotidyl choline is a substance that is synthesized in the human body and plays an important role in fat metabolism. Phosphatidyl choline, which is also used in other areas of medicine, such as liver lubrication, embolic conditions, is applied to the region where the lubrication is high, together with agents that increase blood flow and stimulate tissue. Phosphatidyl choline and ancillary agents are injected into areas with excess fat using the tip-fine lipolysis needle. These substances increase the membrane permeability of the fat cells and allow the fat to break down and be removed from the body. Needle lipolysis, which is done to increase fat destruction, can be defined as the injection of mesotherapy gun or hand by direct injection of fat into needles at 2 cm intervals.

What is Laser Lipolysis?

Laser lipolysis, which is one of the most effective methods of body shaping in recent years, is applied to the areas where fat tissue is dense. The diode laser light, which is applied directly to the membrane of the fat cell, dissolves the cell membrane and allows the oil to be expelled. During this process, the connective tissue that loses its elasticity in time and collagen is also broken down. Instead of the broken connective tissue and collagen, more flexible and more vibrant new cells are formed.

Laser lipolysis, which brings an innovative insight into the treatment of regional lubrication and skin laxity, is also applied to armpit to help prevent excessive sweating. 3D laser lipolysis, which provides permanent reduction of fat cells, tightens the skin and prevents cellulite. 3D laser lipolysis using 3 separate lasers breaks the fibrous bands in the skin and eliminates the roughness. For the application, the region with the highest lubrication is marked and is anesthetized to reduce the heat effect of the laser beam. 1 mm diameter cannula is placed in the area where the laser beams will be applied. Through this cannula, the fat cells expelled from the body.

Who can have Laser Lipolysis?

The procedure can be applied to all healthy people aged 18-75 years. It does not provide weight loss, especially since it is a process for eliminating permanent and regional fats. It is not a suitable method for those with excess weight such as 15-30 kilograms. In order to apply the method, it is recommended that individuals lose weight. It is a suitable treatment method especially for those who have regional lubrication such as waist, hip, abdomen, arm and cellulite, under-chin expansion or eye bags.

But;

  • Pregnant or breastfeeding women
  • Those with drug allergies
  • Infection patients
  • Renal patients
  • Those with liver damage
  • Hemophilia patients
  • Cancer patients
  • Individuals with a history of ischemic attack
  • People who have had a stroke
  • Advanced heart patients
  • Insulin-dependent diabetics are not recommended to apply treatment methods such as needle lipolysis, laser lipolysis and cold lipolysis.

Which areas of the body can lipolysis be applied to?

The process is commonly used for problems such as body deformations, cellulite, fat around the eyes, detention bags and lipoma. Lipolysis method is used in the treatment of deformities that occur after the body oils taken by surgical interventions. The method which is very effective in the fat deposits and especially the problems due to cellulite, is applied to the body areas where the lubrication is seen such as the basin, lower abdomen, waist and stomach, and also to the internal areas of the arms and legs, and to the fat under the jaw and face. The method that supports the increase of collagen production in the skin increases the tension of the skin and makes it look younger.

Bununla birlikte, bazý inatçý yaðlardan kurtulmak çok zor olabilir. Ýnatçý yaðlarý önlemek için iðne lipoliz, lazer lipoliz, soðuk lipoliz ve liposuction gibi lokalize zayýflama yöntemleri kullanýlabilir. Bu zayýflama yöntemleri inatçý yaðlarýn vücuttan çýkarýlmasýný amaçlar.

Lazer lipoliz, aþýrý terlemeyi önlemeye yardýmcý olmak için koltuk altýna da uygulanabilir. Yað hücrelerinin kalýcý olarak azalmasýný saðlayan lazer lipoliz cildi sýkýlaþtýrýr ve selülit oluþumunu önler. Uygulama için, en yüksek yaðlanmaya sahip bölge iþaretlenir ve lazer ýþýnýnýn ýsý etkisini azaltmak için uyuþturulur. Lazer ýþýnlarýnýn atýlacaðý alana 1 mm çapýnda kanül yerleþtirilir. Bu kanül sayesinde, yað hücreleri vücuttan atýlýr.

Kimler Lazer Lipoliz yaptýrabilir?

Ýþlem 18-75 yaþ arasý tüm saðlýklý insanlara uygulanabilir. Özellikle bel, kalça, karýn, kol ve selülit, çene altý geniþlemesi veya göz torbalarý gibi bölgesel yaðlanmasý olanlar için uygun bir tedavi yöntemidir.

Ancak hamile veya emziren kadýnlar, ilaç alerjisi olanlar, enfeksiyon hastalarý, böbrek hastalarý, karaciðer hasarý olanlar, kanserli hastalar, iskemik atak öyküsü olan kiþiler, inme geçiren kiþiler, ileri kalp hastalarý lazer lipoliz yaptýrmamalýdýr.

Vücudun hangi bölgelerine lipoliz uygulanabilir?

Ýþlem genellikle vücut deformasyonlarý, selülit, göz çevresindeki yað, gözaltý torbalarý gibi problemlerde kullanýlýr. Lipoliz yöntemi, cerrahi müdahalelerle alýnan vücut yaðlarýndan sonra meydana gelen deformasyonlarýn tedavisinde kullanýlýr. Yað birikmelerinde ve özellikle selülit kaynaklý sorunlarda çok etkili olan yöntem ayný zamanda bel ve karýn gibi yaðlamanýn görüldüðü vücut bölgelerini ve ayrýca kollarýn iç alanlarýný da içerir. Lazer Lipoliz ciltte kolajen üretiminin artmasýný destekleyen bir yöntem olduðu için cildin gerginliðini arttýrýr ve daha genç görünmesini saðlar.

description:
Hair mesotherapy is the injection of a serum consisting of substances that feed the hair under the skin. Hair mesotherapy is a cosmetic procedure, not a surgical treatment. Applied serum nourishes hair follicles, makes hair healthier and more vivid, reduces shedding. Injection is performed with very fine needle tips. Therefore, pain is minimal during the procedure.

What is Mesotherapy?

Mesotherapy is a technique that uses an injection of vitamins, enzymes, hormones and plant extracts to rejuvenate and tighten the skin, as well as to remove excess fat.

Mesotherapy developed by French Doctor Michel Pistor in 1952 was first used for pain relief. In time, it was used for cosmetic purposes all over the world.

In addition to hair loss treatments, it is used in cases such as aging and sagging of the skin, spottreatments, skin cracks, under-eye bruises and bags.

In which situations is Hair Mesotherapy applied?

  • In Male Pattern Hair Loss
  • In Hair Loss due to seasonal changes
  • In stress-induced hair loss
  • In alopecia-areata(ringworm) disease
  • As a supportive treatment in the healing process after hair transplantation

Who cannot have Hair Mesotherapy?

  • Pregnant women
  • Nursing mothers
  • Diabetic patients
  • Cancer patients
  • Paralyzed people
  • People with blood clotting problems

How is hair mesotherapy performed?

Hair mesotherapy treatment is injected into the middle skin between the scalp and the fat and tissue layer. It is usually applied with 30 minutes sessions. The substances contained in the injected liquid are selected depending on the cause of the hair loss.

In hair mesotherapy, positive changes are observed after 5 to 7 sessions.

1952 yýlýnda Fransýz Doktor Michel Pistor tarafýndan geliþtirilen mezoterapi ilk baþta aðrýyý azaltma amacýyla kullanýldý. Zaman içinde tüm dünyada kozmetik amaçlý kullanýlmaya baþlandý.

description:
Arthroscopy is the imaging of the inside of the joints by using fiberoptic devices. The method used in the past for diagnostic purposes, is used for therapeutic purposes too along with the developing technology now. It is most commonly applied to the knee joint, as well as the shoulder, ankle, hip, elbow and wrist joints.

Why is Arthroscopy performed?

Arthroscopy is required for final diagnosis. The most accurate diagnosis is made by arthroscopy. Diseases and injuries can cause damage to the bones, cartilage, joint ligaments, muscles and tendons. Arthroscopy detects these damages.

In which situations is Arthroscopy used for treatment-purpose?

In the knee joint: removal of torn meniscus fragments, suturing of meniscus tears, anterior and posterior cruciate ligament repairs, early calcification, cartilage transplants, evacuation of joint inflammation, removal of diseased joint membrane, removal of benign tumors and cysts within the joint.

Shoulder: Muscle ruptures, shoulder dislocations, early calcification and so on.

Ankle: Intraarticular fractures, early calcification and so on.

Surgical process

Arthroscopy allows the arthroscope which is a small tube containing optical fibers and lenses, to enter the joint to be examined by making small incisions to the skin. The arthroscope is connected to a video camera and the joint is seen on the monitor. The size of the arthroscope depends on the size of the joint examined. The knee is examined by an arthroscope with a diameter of approximately 5 millimeters. There are arthroscopes as small as 0.5 millimeters in diameter to examine small joints such as the wrist.

Arthroscopic surgery is the general name given to the procedures applied in addition to this routine. After performing the necessary procedures, the surgical area is covered with a bandage. After the surgery, the patient is discharged on that day or the next day.

After surgery

The surgical dressings are removed the next day. Small wounds are dressed. The holes drilled for arthroscopy heal in a few days. It will take several weeks for the holes to fully recover. Patients can return to their daily life after 3-4 days. Athletes can return to sports after 4-6 weeks if their physical condition is sufficient.
description_tr:
Artroskopi fiberoptik cihazlar kullanýlarak, eklemlerin içinin kamera ile görüntülenmesidir. Geçmiþte teþhis amaçlý kullanýlan yöntem, geliþen teknoloji ile birlikte teþhisin yaný sýra tedavi amaçlý da kullanýlmaktadýr. En çok diz eklemine, diz ekleminin yaný sýra omuz, ayak bileði, kalça, dirsek ve el bileði eklemlerine uygulanýr.

Artroskopi neden uygulanýr?

Artroskopi son teþhis için gereklidir. En doðru teþhis artroskopi ile konur. Hastalýklar ve yaralanmalar kemiklerde, kýkýrdakta, eklem baðlarýnda, kas ve tendonlarda hasarlara neden olabilir. Artroskopi ile bu hasarlar tespit edilir.

Artroskopi hangi durumlarda tedavi imkaný saðlar?

Diz ekleminde: Yýrtýk menisküs parçalarýnýn çýkarýlmasý, menisküs yýrtýklarýnýn dikilmesi, ön ve arka çapraz bað tamirleri, erken dönemde kireçlenme, kýkýrdak nakilleri, eklem iltihaplarýnýn boþaltýlmasý, hastalýklý eklem zarýnýn çýkartýlmasý, eklem içindeki iyi huylu tümör ve kistlerin çýkartýlmasý.

Omuz: Kas yýrtýlmalarý, omuz çýkýklarý, erken dönemde kireçlenme vb.

Ayak bileði: Eklem içi kýrýklar, erken dönemde kireçlenme vb.

Cerrahi süreci

Artroskopi, optik lifler ve lensler içeren küçük bir tüp olan artroskopun, incelenecek olan eklem içerisine deriye küçük kesikler yapýlarak girmesini saðlar. Artroskop bir video kameraya baðlanýr ve eklemin iç kýsmý monitörde görülür. Artroskopun büyüklüðü incelenen eklemin büyüklüðüne göre deðiþir. Diz yaklaþýk 5 milimetre çapýnda bir artroskopla incelenir. El bileði gibi küçük eklemleri incelemek için çapý 0,5 milimetre kadar küçük artroskopler bulunmaktadýr.

Atroskopk cerrahi bu rutine ek olarak uygulanan prosedürlere verilen genel isimdir. Gerekli prosedürler uygulandýktan sonra ameliyat bölgesi bir bandaj ile sarýlýr. Ameliyat sonrasý, o gün veya ertesi gün hasta taburcu edilir.

Cerrahi sonrasý

Hastalar 3-4 gün sonra günlük hayatýna geri dönebilir. Sporcular eðer fizik kondisyonlarý yeterli hale gelirse 4-6 hafta sonra spora dönebilir.

description:
Spinal surgery is the name given to surgical procedures performed on the nerve, spinal cord roots and spines that protect these structures. Frequent movements in daily life can cause pain in case of curvature of the spine or any disease.

Approximately 80% of adults have experienced spinal pain at least once in their lives. Having such a common complaint increases the importance of spine diseases from an orthopedic perspective. Spine surgery is examined under more than one subheading.

Back and Neck Hernia

It is caused by mechanical force of the discs between the vertebrae or degenerative effects over the years. Whether the patient has a surgical condition or not is decided according to the degree of the disease and the condition of the patient.

Traumas

Spine fractures are frequently seen in cases such as vehicle accidents, falling from a big height and work accidents. It can cause a traumatic damage to the spine and spinal cord, short or long-term serious problems and life-threatening and irreversible damage. The location and the degree of fracture are determined by the doctor. And according to that the treatment plan is made. Untreated spinal fractures may result in serious spinal cord injuries. Timely and correct intervention in spine trauma; prevents unresolved problems that may arise in the future.

Tumors

Surgery is an effective treatment for spinal cord and spine tumors. Spinal cord tumors can cause different signs and symptoms, especially as tumors grow. Tumors can affect your spine or nerve roots, blood vessels, or the bones of your spine.

Most of the tumors of the spine occur when the tumor in another part of the body splashes into the spine bones. Tumors with the highest risk of splashing into the bones; lung, breast and prostate cancers. Tumors originating directly from the spine bones without tumors elsewhere in the body are rare.

Scoliosis

Scoliosis is the lateral curvature of the back and waist of the spine. In a healthy spine, the vertebrae lie in a straight line when it is seen from the back.

The course of curvature of the spine, which is considered to be a finding related to another disease rather than a single disease, also varies according to the patient.

Omurga cerrahisi sinir, omurilik kökleri ve bu yapýlarý koruyan omurga üzerinde yapýlan cerrahi giriþimlere verilen isimdir. Omurgada eðrilik veya herhangi bir hastalýk olmasý durumunda günlük yaþantýda sýkça yapýlan hareketler aðrýya neden olabilir.

Yetiþkinlerin yaklaþýk %80'i hayatlarýnda en az bir kez omurga kaynaklý aðrý yaþamýþtýr. Bu kadar sýk karþýlaþýlan bir þikayet olmasý ortopedik açýdan omurga hastalýklarýnýn önemini artýrmaktadýr. Omurga cerrahisi birden fazla alt baþlýk altýnda incelenir.

Araç kazalarý, yüksekten düþme, iþ kazalarý gibi durumlarda omurga kýrýklarý sýklýkla görülür. Omurga ve omurilikte meydana gelen travmatik hasarlar, kýsa veya uzun vadede ciddi problemler, yaþamý tehdit edici ve geri dönüþümsüz hasarlar yaratabilir. Doktor tarafýndan; kýrýðýn yeri ve derecesi tespit edilir.. Buna göre tedavi planlamasý yapýlýr. Tedavi edilmeyen omurga kýrýklarý, ciddi omurilik yaralanmalarý ile sonuçlanabilir. Omurga travmalarýna zamanýnda ve doðru müdahale ise; gelecekte ortaya çýkabilecek çözümsüz sorunlarý engeller.

Tümörler

Omurilik ve omurga tümörleri için etkili tedavi yöntemi cerrahidir. Omurilik tümörleri, özellikle tümörler büyüdükçe farklý iþaret ve semptomlara neden olabilir. Tümörler omurganýzý veya sinir köklerini, kan damarlarýný veya omurganýzýn kemiklerini etkileyebilir.

Omurga tümörlerinin önemli bir kýsmý vücudun baþka bir bölgesindeki tümörün omurga kemiklerine sýçramasý ile ortaya çýkar. Kemiklere sýçrama riski en yüksek olan tümörler; akciðer, meme ve prostat kanserleridir. Vücudun baþka bir yerinde tümör olmaksýzýn direkt olarak omurga kemiklerinde köken alan tümörler ise nadir görülür.

Skolyoz

Skolyoz, omurganýn sýrt ve bel bölgesinin yana doðru eðriliði olmasýdýr. Saðlýklý bir omurgada arkadan bakýldýðýnda omurlar düz bir hat þeklinde uzanýrken, skolyoz durumunda omurlar saða veya sola doðru eðrilir ve ayný zamanda kendi eksenleri etrafýnda döner.

Tek baþýna bir hastalýktan çok baþka bir hastalýða baðlý olarak ortaya çýkan bir bulgu olarak kabul edilen omurga eðriliðinin seyri de hastaya göre farklýlýk gösterir. Bu nedenle skolyozda tedavi yaklaþýmýnýn da ayný doðrultuda hastaya göre farklýlaþmasý gerekir.

description:
Abdominal etching is an aesthetic operation that allows people to create a faster and more accurate view of the muscular abdomen formed by sports exercises. Due to the technique called vaser liposuction, it is ensured that the fat in the abdomen is removed and the remaining fat is arranged to reveal the muscles.

Who can have Abdominal Etching surgery?

  • Men and women in the young and middle age groups who want to have an athletic appearance.
  • People with areal fat excesses.
  • People who have difficulty in developing muscle and making them visible.
  • Muscle aesthetics can be applied to people who do not have time to perform an intensive exercise program and who want to have a muscular body in a short time.

Surgery process

Surgery is performed under general anesthesia. Surgical incisions are made 4-5 mm long. In areas with abdominal muscles, adipose tissue is preserved or increased according to need. The adipose tissue in the areas where the muscles are dimpled is taken by liposuction technique. The operation takes an average of 1 hour.

Things to consider after surgery

  • The patient is discharged the next day after the operation. The patient should pay attention to the hygiene.
  • After the operation, the patient will need to use a corset during the time that the doctor recommends. The patient needs to avoid compelling activities while using the corset.
  • The habits that will adversely affect the healing process such as smoking and alcohol should be stopped at least in the three-week period following the operation.

description:
Due to excessive weight loss and aging, the skin loses elasticity and its subcutaneous fat decreases. In these cases, sagging occurs in the upper part of the arm. Arm lift surgery solves this problem.

Surgery process

Arm lift operation is performed under general anesthesia. It may take 1 to 3 hours depending on the sagging of the arm. If there is a limited amount of sagging in the arm skin or armpit, the incision is made only in the armpit. In most cases, the prolapse extends to the elbow. In these cases, the incision made extends from the armpit to the elbow. Sagging skin and excess fat under the skin are removed. The incision area is closed with stitches. Support stitches can be placed to prevent reopening the stitches due to arm movements. Elastic bandages are placed on the arm after the operation. The hospital stay is 1 day.

Recovery process

After arm lift surgery, the bruises and swellings on the arm last for about 15 days. The patient uses a bruise cream to remove these swelling and bruises. The elastic bandage attached to the arm should not be removed for at least 4 weeks. The patient can take a shower on the third day. Arm movements should be at minimum level for 15 days. Sports activities should be avoided for 2 months. Regular dressing should be done for 15 days. Daily massage applied to arm improves blood circulation and healing.

description:
Breasts sag with the effect of gravity, pregnancy and breastfeeding as time passes.Excessive and sudden weight changes affects the breasts negatively. Deformed breasts can be lifted, leaving their volumes the same by breast lift surgery. This lift process is called Breast Lift (Mastopexy).

In breast lift surgery, the nipple and breast tissues are moved upwards and the exess and sagging skin is removed. Breast lift surgery provides an aesthetic shape and fullness to the breasts in addition providing rejuvenation and form.

Who are suitable for breast lift surgery?

Breast Lift Surgery Process

  • People who are physically healthy and have a stable weight
  • People who feel uncomfortable about their sagged or deformed breasts
  • People with sagged nipples
  • People where one breast is more sagging than the other
  • Things to consider before the operation

Your medical evaluation will be made before the operation. It is important that you tell your doctor about all medications you use. Alcohol and smoking should be stopped before the operation and the use of blood thinners such as aspirin should be avoided.

There are many techniques used for breast lift surgery. These techniques should be selected individually. The most important determinant here is the size of the breast, the degree of flap and its structure. The most secure, personalized and least permanent techniques are used. As a result of this operation, the erogenous and touch sense of the breast, especially the breast-feeding function of the breast are protected.

In the breast lift operation, the sagging breast and breast tissue are increased to the desired level. The sagging skin in the breast is discarded and the dark area around the nipple called isola is returned to the pre-pregnancy appearance.

The breast size is not changed unless a patient wants it, there is no technical necessity. In addition, if desired, it is possible to reduce or enlarge the breasts in the same operation.

Recovery Process

Bandage and corset are used in the operation area after breast lift surgery. Pain may be felt when the effect of anesthesia is over. Painkillers should be used regularly.

There may be drowsiness, sensitization at the nipple, scratching of the incision or hardening of the breast tissue. These side effects will pass within a few weeks. There's no need to worry.

All instructions must be followed after the surgery. Corset clothing, the use of painkillers with antibiotics and appropriate exercises are some of these instructions.
description_tr:
Göðüsler, zaman geçtikçe yerçekiminin, hamilelik ve emzirmenin etkisiyle sarkar. Kýsa sürede kilo alýmý göðüsleri olumsuz yönde etkiler. Meme dikleþtirme ameliyatý ile deforme olmuþ memeler hacimleri ayný býrakýlarak dikleþtirilebilir.

Meme dikleþtirme ameliyatýnda meme baþý ve meme dokularý yukarý doðru hareket ettirilir ve gevþek ve sarkýk cilt çýkarýlýr. Meme dikleþtirme ameliyatý, memelere estetik bir þekil ve dolgunluk saðlar, göðsün gençleþmesini ve form almasýný saðlar.

Kimler meme dikleþtirme ameliyatý için uygundur?

Göðüslerinizin sarkma ya da þeklini ve hacmini kaybetme hissinin rahatsýzlýk verdiði kiþiler

Meme uçlarý aþaðýya sarkmýþ kiþiler

Operasyon öncesi dikkat edilmesi gerekenler

Operasyon öncesi týbbi deðerlendirmeniz yapýlacaktýr. Doktorunuza kullandýðýnýz bütün ilaçlarý bildirmeniz önemlidir. Operasyon öncesi alkol ve sigara kullanýmý durdurulmalý ve aspirin gibi kan sulandýrýcý ilaçlarýn kullanýmýndan kaçýnýlmalýdýr.

Operasyon süreci

Meme dikleþtirme operasyonunda kullanýlan farklý teknikler vardýr. Operasyon sýrasýnda kullanýlacak teknik kiþiye göre seçilir. Buradaki belirleyiciler:

  • Meme büyüklüðü ve þekli
  • Areolalarýnýzýn büyüklüðü ve konumu
  • Memenin sarkma derecesi

En güvenli ve kiþiye uygun teknikler kullanýlýr. Bu iþlem sonucunda memenin erojen bölge ve emzirme iþlevi korunur.

Operasyon genel anestezi altýnda uygulanýr.

Meme dikleþtirme operasyonunda, sarkan meme ve meme dokusu istenen seviyeye çýkarýlýr. Memedeki sarkan cilt alýnýr ve meme ucu etrafýndaki koyu renkli alan gebelik öncesi görünüme döndürülür.

Bir hasta istemediði sürece meme büyüklüðü deðiþmez, teknik bir zorunluluk yoktur. Ek olarak, istenirse, ayný operasyonda göðüsleri küçültmek veya büyütmek mümkündür.

Ýyileþme süreci

description:
Breast reduction is a surgical operation to reduce the aesthetic concerns of the breast and to resolve physical complaints.

How to determine the ideal breast type?

The extent to which the breasts are reduced is determined by the ratio of height, weight and body dimensions. A general reduction is achieved if both breasts are of equal dimensions. However, if there is a proportional difference between the two breasts and the size of the small breast is normal, the two breasts are equalized and the dimensions are determined in this way.

Surgery process

  • First, how much of the breast will be reduced and how will it be shaped,is determined.
  • The patient is prepared for surgery and general anesthesia is performed.
  • The incisions are opened by the surgeon and excess breast tissue is removed.
  • The breast shape is revised and the incisions are stitched and the operation is terminated.

What is the age limit for breast reduction?

For this surgery, the patient must have completed the development of his body and breasts. Therefore, performing this operation before puberty is inconvenient. This operation can be performed from 20 years of age in patients who want to undergo breast reduction surgery and review breastfeeding.

Things to consider before the surgery

Your medical evaluation will be made before the operation. It is important that you tell your doctor about all medications you use. Alcohol and smoking should be stopped before the operation and the use of blood thinners such as aspirin should be avoided.

Things to consider after the surgery

During the rest and recovery process after the operation, the instructions given by the doctor should be followed and a special bra should be used. In addition, mammography should be taken and checked when the full recovery period is over. In this way, possible risks are prevented and the operation is successful.

Recovery period

Like any surgical procedure, Breast Reduction surgery also has a healing process. In the early period of the healing process, side effects such as bruising and swelling improve. The main development is the period starting with the removal of stitches. At the end of this period, the breasts become completely natural, take a new shape and the scars disappear.

description:
Brazilian butt lift is a gluteal augmentation surgery, that gives the buttock a straight and rounded, plump, tight and younger look.

It is especially applied to people who are not satisfied with the appearance of their hips in size and shape, who want a younger, more active and more feminine appearance.

Fat cells taken from other parts of the body by vaser liposuction are purified by various procedures and converted into a stem cell rich fat tissue. It is then used to clarify and fill the butt lines. These fat cells, taken from the patient's own body, are capable of self-renewal and there is no risk of the body refusing this procedure because it is the patient's own tissue.

Who can have Brazilian Butt Lift surgery (BBL surgery)?

People, who want to have a butt suited with their bodies can have Brazilian Butt Aesthetics. Those who have a straight butt shape may have a prominent butt shape with BBL.

If there are effects such as sagging, loosening or flattening in the butt area due to aging or weight loss, you can be a suitable candidate for this aesthetic operation. If your clothing doesn't look the way you want it to, and you don't have any health problems, and you have realistic expectations about the operation, you can be a candidate for Brazilian butt lift.

Surgery process

It is an operation which is performed under general anesthesia. It takes 2-3 hours. The fats are taken from predetermined areas of the body by liposuction method. After the fat is removed from the stem cells. Processed body fat is transferred to the determined areas of the hip.

Things to consider after surgery

  • Postoperative pain is normal. Painkillers should be used.
  • The patient should not take a shower for at least 3 days after the operation.
  • The patient should use a corset for 3 months after the operation.
  • Heavy exercises should be avoided for 3 weeks.

description:
Cosmetic surgeries performed on the eyelid are called Blepharoplasty. Eyelids are the finest skin structure in the body, protecting very sensitive structures. The eyelids are constantly moving and are easily affected by environmental and genetic factors. The signs of aging first start with the formation of wrinkles and eye bags around the eye.

Over time, the tension of the eyelids is reduced and sagging occurs. Eyelid surgeries can be performed not only for aesthetic reasons, but also because of congenital or posterior eyelid defects or skin tumors on the eyelid.

What is the purpose of Blepharoplasty surgery?

Upper eyelid skins that are sagged can be removed with Blepharoplasty. Eye bags can be taken. This surgery allows patients to have a sharper and more impressive look. Tired, angry or sleepy appearances of the patients with common complaints are corrected by eyelid aesthetic surgery.

Things to consider before surgery

Blepharoplasty surgery is simpler than other plastic surgeries. However, preoperative evaluations of the patient's general health status, wound healing properties and eye health research is done meticulously. The patient should report to the doctor all the medications before surgery.

Recovery process

Swelling and redness may occur around the eyes after Blepharoplasty. After the third day, swelling and redness begin to decrease. After one week, the sutures and bands around the eyes are removed. The bruises pass completely. After surgery, drugs such as eye drops, antibiotics, pain relief, and edema reduction will be prescribed by the doctor. During the first week, activities such as reading books, using computers, watching television that can cause dryness of the eye should be avoided. Heavy exercises and activities should be avoided for 4 weeks.

description:
Aesthetic surgery operations to eliminate aging, non-aesthetic appearance are called face lift surgery.

Facelift surgery is the process that provides the longest persistence and gives the most accurate image. Although other non-surgical facelift operations are effective, facelift surgeries are more successful in people with very dense sagging, wrinkling, fold and excess skin appearance.

Facelift surgery process

Aesthetic surgery operations to eliminate aging, non-aesthetic appearance are called face lift surgery.

Facelift surgery is the process that provides the longest persistence and gives the most accurate image. Although other non-surgical facelift operations are effective, facelift surgeries are more successful in people with very dense sagging, wrinkling, fold and excess skin appearance.

  • It starts with the preparation of the patient for the surgery.
  • For operation with general or local anesthesia, the patient is anesthetized by the expert according to his / her longitudinal weight.
  • The surgeon performs the operation by opening the incisions and terminates the operation by closing the incisions with special sutures at the end of the operation, in which the bladed scars are unclear.
  • The duration of anesthesia and surgery lasts 3 - 4 hours in total.

Who can have Facelift operation?

  • Patients who are especially 40 - 50 years of age and have very dense sagging, folded skin,
  • Patients who loses the contour of face and neck and,
  • Patients who are tired of their age and have a negative appearance, are suitable for this operation. Both men and women can have this procedure.

Things to consider before surgery

If it is decided that the patient is eligible for the surgery as a result of consultation, the doctor's recommendations should be followed until the day of surgery. Especially;

  • The use of tobacco products creates negative consequences for and after such surgical procedures. For this reason, such consumption should be quitted at least 1 week before the operation.
  • Also, the use of drugs that dilute the blood should be stopped some time before surgery.

Things to consider after surgery

The period after the operation is very important. Tobacco products and blood thinning medications should not be used as the period of recovery begins. One day after the operation, the patient should stay in hospital and should be rested for 1 week after discharge. In addition, the doctor's recommendations should be followed, hard work-outs and exercises should be avoided, make-up, cosmetics and chemical products should not be used for a certain period of time, shower with hot water should be avoided.

Recovery process

After the operation, bruises, swelling, edema and some temporary scars occur. The medication recommended by your doctor should be used for these to heal. In time, swelling and bruises disappear, and the tissues become more natural by improving. Towards the final stages of healing, the traces of surgery, stitch marks become natural in proportion to the skin color and their appearance disappears.

description:
Breast fat transfer is the transfer of the fat from the patient's body to the breast.

Every adult woman can have breast fat transfer. However, this procedure is more suitable for patients with excess fat in their body. Fat tissue is taken from the body with liposuction and applied to the breast will also provide thinning in the body. This procedure also means liposuction for women with excess fat.

Surgery Process

Breast fat transfer is performed under general or local anesthesia according to the patient's condition. After the procedure, the patient is discharged on the same day. During the transfer of the breast fat, fat is extracted from the needed areas by liposuction method. However, the withdrawal of the fat cells is performed in a lower vacuum with thinner cannulas than the liposuction method. The rich fat tissue obtained from the stem cell is then separated from the fat tissue by the centrifugation technique. Fat tissue is then ready for transfer and the breast is injected between the mammary gland and the breast. Because the injected separated fat tissue is rich in stem cells, it will also repair damaged tissues in the region where it is injected.

After the intervention, there will also be a serious thinning of the fat-drawn area.

Things to consider after surgery

The patient can take a shower about 3 days after the operation and return to the daily life after discharge. The patient may return to work after about 3-5 days of rest. Heavy activities and exercises are allowed after 1 month.

The retention time of the injected oils varies from person to person. As this is a type of grafting process, some of the transferred cells continue to live in the transferred region. Thus, approximately 40-50% will be permanent.

description:
Gynecomastia is the name given to the problem of male breasts due to fatigue and hormones. The development of chest muscles is not defined as gynecomastia.

Gynecomastia usually occurs due to hormonal imbalances. Side effects of drugs that cause psychological stress can occasionally cause gynecomastia. Gynecomastia is seen in 40% of men between the ages of 10 and 16, where hormonal changes are intensified, and can be 65% during the fastest period of puberty. During puberty, 75% of gynecomastia is self-recovered in two years and 90% in three years. When the hormone balance in the body is restored at the end of adolescence, most gynecomastia are self-healing. Very few of them may not recover. Gynecomastia which is seen in advanced ages is usually caused by accumulation of fats in the chest area.

Gynecomastia Treatment

When the mammary gland is detected in the patient, only the excess of the mammary gland is removed. If there is excess fat in the mammary gland and breast tissue, the mammary gland as well as the fat tissue are treated. If the problem in the breast is only the increase in breast fat, the breast fat is reduced without a surgical intervention on the mammary gland.

Gynecomastia Surgery

Gynecomastia operation is performed under local or general anesthesia in the hospital and lasts for 1 hour. Pre-operative planning is performed. If there is an excess of the mammary gland, the excess mammary gland is removed from the lower part of the nipple with an u-shaped incision. If there is an increase in fat in the breast, the laser liposuction is also added to the treatment. Only if there is an excess of fat in the breast and the mammary gland is normal only laser lipolysis is applied.

A large number of patients can be treated with these methods. If the nipple and breast skin is too drooping then breast lift surgery can also be done. In such a case, an incision downwardly extending or an inverted T-shaped is performed from around the nipple. These traces and lengths will increase as the breast sag.

Recovery Process

After gynecomastia surgery, the patient may return to work on the same day. After the surgery, a bandage or elastic bandage is applied to the breast area. After 3 days the patient can take a shower. The patient should wear a corset for 2-3 weeks.

description:
Depending on different factors, the inner labia of the vagina and the surrounding tissue may sag. Surgical operations performed to remove this sagging are called Labiaplasty. In cases where one of the inner lips is longer than the other, asymmetric image can be corrected with labiaplasty. Women can have labiaplasty surgery who are uncomfortable with the appearance of their vagina.

Surgery Process

The excess skin on the deformed inner lips is reduced so that they do not hang from the outer lips. The operation is completed by dissolvable surgical sutures. There is no need for a second process to remove the sutures. The sutures fall spontaneously within 10 days.

This surgery is planned depending on the menstruation date of the person. The ideal operative time is between the end of the period or the 1week before the next period.

Recovery Process

  • During the recovery period, it should be paid attention to keep the operating area dry and hygienic.
  • Swelling and pain are normal. It disappears in about a week. In this process, the doctor recommended pain relief should be used regularly.
  • You can take a shower on the same day after surgery. It is important not to sit in the bathtub and keep the shower short. You should wait at least 2 weeks for baths, pool, sauna.
  • At least 4 weeks sexual intercourse is not recommended. No buffer should be used for at least 10 days.
  • During 1 month, it is important not to ride on vehicles that can put pressure on the region such as bicycles and motorcycles. It is necessary to avoid physical activities and sports that will cause the impact.
  • Bleeding can be observed for 10 days after labioplasty surgery.

description:
Liposuction is the removal of fats which do not melt and cause non-aesthetic images by surgical intervention. This procedure is performed by removing the subcutaneous fat tissues with a vacuum device. The patient does not feel any pain because the operation is performed under anesthesia.

What is the type of anesthesia?

The type of anesthesia is determined according to the type of operation. If the liposuction procedure is to be applied in the small areas, the relaxing medicines combined with local anesthesia are administered to the patient before the operation. General anesthesia is more appropriate if liposuction is to be performed in a large area of the body.

What are the operation steps?

  • First, the appropriate anesthesia type is administered to the patient in the appropriate manner and at the dose.
  • The surgeon opens the incisions to the designated places.
  • From the opened incisions, the excess pressure is taken with the device that presses the vacuum in the opposite direction.
  • The operation incision of 2 cm depth is closed and the operation is terminated.

How much fat is taken with liposuction procedure?

This varies from patient to patient. The amount of fat to be taken in each patient is different. The determination is made according to the weight of the patient and the amount of fat that can be taken in the problem area. There is a certain limit of fats in all regions. This limit can sometimes be 3 kilos of fat and sometimes 6 kilos of fat.

Which areas can liposuction be applied?

This process can be applied in almost all areas where unwanted fats are clustered.

  • Abdominal
  • Base
  • Cellulite areas
  • Leg - calf
  • Arm
  • Back
  • Belly

Pre-operative: First of all the doctor is examined the patient and it is determined which areas should be taken. If the patient does not have an obstacle for taking anesthesia and operation, the operation plan is determined.

Post-operative: The first step after the operation, the patient should be wearing a special corset. This corset is both shapers and prevents possible swelling, edema, and leaks of unwanted fluids. Then the patient should follow the doctor's recommendations and use the necessary pain relievers. Painkillers used for headaches after this operation are enough. One week after the operation, water, cosmetic products, chemicals should not be brought into contact with the treated area.

Recovery Process

The most important thing in this process is the recommendations of the doctor. With this method, which has been done for many years, problems in the healing process have not been encountered frequently.

After 1 week of rest after the operation patient can return to daily life. The operation area should be protected and post-operative corset should be used.

Is the surgery risky?

Liposuction has a small amount of risks, such as any surgery under anesthesia. These risks are the problems that may occur in bleeding and infection. To avoid such problems, the surgeon and the clinic who will perform the liposuction operation should be selected well. A sterile environment is very important for such operations.

Why is it important to use a special corset after liposuction?

The corset is both a means of shaping and making the healing process healthy and fast. With the removal of adipose tissues, it softens in other oils and needs to be formed and possible blood and other liquid leaks are a little. In addition, swelling and edema recovery should be lost faster. For these reasons, the use of the corset should be used within the period determined by the doctor.

description:
Cosmetic surgeries related to the size of the breast nipples are called nipple reshaping surgery.

Nipple reshaping surgeries are usually performed with breast-forming surgeries. The single-handed nozzle aesthetics is less done. When done alone can be done with local anesthesia. It takes approximately half an hour to one hour. The patient can return to her daily life the same day.

Inverted Nipple

Inverted nipple is usually caused by short milk channels from the breast tissue or by pulling the muscle behind the nipple. Inverted nipple may be congenital or posterior. Due to the accumulation of secretions from the nipple and the difficulty of cleaning, there may be difficulties in breastfeeding with problems such as infection. The most important reason for this problem is the inability to develop milk channels. Since the milk channels are opened to the nipple, this part has to be turned inwards, making it difficult for the baby to catch the nipple and preventing milk flow. In addition, because it does not look aesthetically pleasing, it can damage one's self-confidence and lead to psychological and sexual problems.

Inverted nipple is treated surgically. It is done under local anesthesia and lasts up to 1 hour. There are many surgical methods to correct this problem. The common point of all methods is to cut the bonds that pull the nipple and to provide temporary or permanent support under the nipple. In the majority of techniques performed during surgery, the milk ducts must be cut in order to pull the nipple out. If the channels are not interrupted, the nipple will still collapse after surgery. Because the main reason is pulling the nipple in the milk channels. Therefore, breast feeding is not possible in the future due to cutting of milk channels. Surgically removed breast tip is brought to normal anatomical positions. As a result, the operasyon is made especially for aesthetic concerns or appearance correction. Patients may return to normal life within few days after surgery.

Nipple Reduction

Nipples grows more than normal, can occur in adolescence, as well as postpartum milking may occur. This procedure is usually performed with breast reduction surgery.

Such nipple size can also be seen in women with non-large breasts and can be achieved with an easy correction surgery. In such cases, the problem can often be corrected by small intervention performed under local anesthesia conditions. After the operation, a nipple can be obtained which has shrunk after the operation and whose sense is normal and the milk supply is intact.

Bu meme ucu büyük olmayan memeli kadýnlarda da görülebilir ve kolay bir düzeltme ameliyatý iel sorun çözülebilir. Lokal anestezi altýnda yapýlýr. Ameliyattan sonra hastanýn memenin büyüklüðüne uygun ve duyusu kaybolmayan ve emzirme yönünden bir sorunu olmayan bir meme ucuna sahip olmasý mümkündür.

description:
Flap-ear is the lack of folds in the upper part of the ear and the angle between the head and the ear is bigger than normal. This makes the ear seems open more than usual and becomes even more noticeable from the back. With otoplasty surgery, the ears are approached to the head and the missing folds are formed.

Anyone whose cartilage area larger than the ears, which means who has a flap-eared, and anyone who feels uncomfortable with this situation can easily have this procedure.

How is Otoplasty surgery done?

The surgery is performed under general anaesthesia for under age patients and performed under local anaesthesia for adults. A small incision is made at the back of the ear which is called the auricle, the excess skin is removed and aligned with the general size of the ear. A small number of stitches and bandages are applied to the incision. Bandages are to be changed every day or so for 2-3 weeks. Stitches are removed after 10 days. The process takes 1-2 hours in total.

During the healing process, it is necessary not to lie on a high pillow and to avoid involuntarily movements that will bend the ear.

Things to consider before surgery

  • Use of alcohol should be stopped before 2 weeks from the surgery.
  • In case of any disease, such as high blood pressure, high cholesterol, goitre disease, allergy, chronic diseases, etc... It should be reported to the doctor.
  • The doctor should be notified if any sickness such as flu, cold, sore throat or dryness occur before 1-7 days from the surgery.
  • Smoking reduces the amount of oxygen in the blood. Therefore, healing of wounds becomes difficult and takes more time. Therefore; it is recommended to stop smoking two weeks before the surgery.

Things to consider after surgery

  • Patients need to rest at home for at least 3 days after the surgery.
  • After the bandages are removed, the use of the recommended head band is required for 1 week. This is very important in order to keep the ears from re-opening.
  • Dressing should be changed as recommended and directed by the doctor and shouldn't be delayed.
  • The patients should avoid bending, twisting or folding the ear for about 2 months after operation.

Recovery process

Children after 1 week, adults within 7 days can return to their daily lives. Swellings arising because of the surgery disappear gradually within 2-3 weeks. After 3 weeks, normal exercises can be performed. Avoid any activity that could damage the ear and cause it to bend for 1.5 months. The ear takes the last form within 4-6 weeks.

The last form of the ear and the non-surgical appearance is shown after 3 months. Regardless, as with any type of surgery the final result in otoplasty is shown after 1 year for most patients.

Hasta ameliyattan sonraki bir hafta içinde okula veya iþe geri dönebilir. Düzenli aktivite ve egzersiz 2 hafta içinde tekrar baþlayabilir.

7 gün içinde hasta günlük yaþamýna dönebilir. Ameliyattan kaynaklanan þiþlikler 2-3 hafta içinde yavaþ yavaþ kaybolur. 3 hafta sonra normal egzersizler yapýlabilir. description:
Rhinoplasty means nose job. It is an operation to fix nose-related health problems and provide an aesthetic appearance.

Why people prefer rhinoplasty?

The operation is performed to eliminate the complaints of the patients who do not like their nose shape, who want to have a smaller and aesthetic nose, who have health problems due to nose shape and who have nose structure changes as a result of an accident or trauma.

Rhinoplasty operations give very successful results when the instructions in the recovery process are followed.

How is it performed?

Rhinoplasty is a surgical operation. The operation is performed by the surgeon under general anesthesia.

The first step is the medical examination. In the examination, the doctor listens to the patient's complaints and requests. Then it is determined, how the shape of the nose should be made, how the complaints will be resolved and which appearance will make the patient looks more aesthetic.

After the operation process is planned, operation steps start.

  • The patient is prepared for the operation psychologically and physically
  • General anesthesia allows the patient to sleep without any feeling during operation.
  • The surgery begins and the corrections determined by the surgeon are made one by one.
  • The incisions are sutured sleekly and thinly and the operation is terminated.

Things to consider before surgery

Before the operation, the first stage is to decide whether a permanent change in the nose is really desired or not. Before the operation, smoking and use of alcohol is quited and use of blood thinning medications such as asprin should be avoided. Because such substances affect the success of the surgery and the healing process. The pre-operation instructions of the doctor should be followed carefully.

What happens after the operation?

The post-operative period is the most important stage. It is critical for both the patient and the preservation of the nose structure.

After the operation, the doctor's advice should be followed and the pain killer recommended by the doctor for the pain that starts when the effect of anesthesia passes should not be neglected.

In case of possible infections, antibiotics or other drugs recommended by your doctor should be used.

After the surgery, bandages, dressings, and hygienic rules are also important. In this regard, the doctor's recommendations should be heard and the bandages should be renewed at the specified intervals.

After the surgery, the nose must be protected against impacts. The patient should not take a shower with hot water.

Who can have rhinoplasty surgery?

There is no gender discrimination in rhinoplasty surgery. Men and women can have rhinoplasty surgery.

Who can't have rhinoplasty surgery

  • Pregnant women
  • Breastfeeding mothers
  • Young people who have not completed their body structure and hormonal development
  • Patients receiving regular medication for severe illnesses such as cancer
  • Patients with diseases such as diabetes and blood clotting problems

How long does the recovery process last after rhinoplasty?

The recovery process after rhinoplasty varies according to the technique used, the manner of intervention and the personal characteristics of the patient. The mean recovery time after rhinoplasty varies between 7 and 10 days. Many patients can easily return to their daily life in as little as a week.

description:
Physical changes occur in the legs, such as loss of skin elasticity and decreased fat tissue due to aging. Frequent weight gain, excessive weight loss, and the effect of gravity causes the problem of sagging. This also causes other problems such as sweating and rash. It is more accurate to apply liposuction, which is not an ophthalmologic method, in patients who have an excess of fat on the inner side of the leg and who do not have a sagging skin. If the tissues have not lost their vitality, it is possible to take the fats of this area with liposuction. However, liposuction surgery is not the right choice if there are loosening of the skin depending on the progress of age. In this case, it is more appropriate to remove excess fat from the skin with the excess skin and provide normal skin tension. Thigh lift surgery is performed in these cases.

Surgery process

During thigh lift surgery, the sags on the inner leg just below the pubic area are hidden in the skin. This lifted skin creates an aesthetic view.

The dilation and sagging of the skin may start from the groin and continue downwards. In this case, the skin cannot be concealed. A portion of the skin should be removed. In this process, the excess skin is cut and removed to provide a lifted view in the thigh. If the skin is too thick for lifting, this is done in conjunction with liposuction. After the liposuction procedure, stretching can be performed to prevent sagging of the skin. In the process where the excess skin is removed, a straight line is left on the inside of the leg. These traces do not create a great visual distress. There are also treatments for traces.
General anesthesia is performed during the thigh lifting. That's why the patient stays in the hospital one day. In order to prevent the accumulation of liquids after the process, a drain can be placed on the leg. The corset is used for a period of one month after the procedure.

Recovery process

Thigh lift surgery is an operation requiring general anesthesia. It takes approximately 2 hours. One day stay in hospital is enough. Postoperative pain is mild. The mild pain you will experience with pain relieving medications will not disturb the patient. The patient can stand up the same day. After the surgery, there may be swelling and bruising on the inner face of the leg. The swelling and bruising may last for a few weeks. The patient is able to do air travel 2-3 days after the operation. Bathing can be done 2-3 days after surgery. The period of recovery varies greatly from person to person. Full recovery is achieved in about 7-10 days. Work that requires power and sporty movements can be started after 4 weeks.

description:
Tummy Tuck (Abdominoplasty) is a surgical procedure in which the excess fat and sagging skin tissue in the middle and lower abdomen is removed and the abdominal muscles are stretched and tightened.

Tummy Tuck surgery process

First, general anesthesia is applied to the patient. As with every anesthesia, the person is anesthetized according to the height, weight and age of the person. Depending on the type of tummy tuck to be applied, incisions are opened and stretching is performed and the incisions are sutured and the operation is completed.

What are the types of Tummy Tuck surgery?

There are 2 types of tummy tuck surgery. The reason of being 2 types is the change in operation depth according to the intensity of the sags and folds in the abdomen.

Type 1 Classic Tummy Tuck Operation: It is an operation for very dense sagging. It takes 2-3 hours.

Type 2 Partial Tummy Tuck Operation: It is an operation performed for non-intense sagging. It takes 1-2 hours.

Who can have Tummy Tuck surgery?

People who are stable in weight, who do not have health problems that may prevent recovery or increase the risk of surgery, who have realistic goals, who are determined to maintain a healthy lifestyle, proper nutrition, fitness, are suitable candidates for Tummy Tuck surgery. This surgery is not recommended for people who are planning to give birth and have not tried diet and weight loss methods.

Things to consider before the surgery?

Your medical evaluation will be made before the operation. It is important that you inform your doctor about all medications you use. Alcohol and smoking should be stopped before the operation and the use of blood thinners such as aspirin should be avoided.

Things to consider after the surgery?

You may need to use an elastic bandage or corset over the incisions during healing to minimize swelling and to support your abdomen while healing after surgery. Care should be taken to use cosmetic and chemical products. It may be necessary to rest for 1 to 2 weeks after the operation. During this period, heavy activities that will affect the abdomen should not be done.

description:
Vaginoplasty is a procedure that is applied to vagina for sagging and dilation problem. This procedure is performed with surgical intervention and it is treated within the scope of aesthetic surgery.

As a result of the procedure applied to the vaginal area, the tissues that have undergone sagging and enlargement are restored. The purpose of the procedure is to correct the look of the patient's genital area.

Due to birth or age-related deformations, various sagging of the vagina can be seen. The sagging is a natural process that occurs in every woman. For this reason, most women prefer to solve this problem and have vaginoplasty.

Vaginoplasty is a very simple operation. This operation, which does not have any major risks, is completed in less than an hour and the patient continues to her normal life in a very short time.

Surgery Process

Surgery is performed under general anesthesia. Due to the fact that the operation is made in a sensitive area and contains sutures, doctors generally prefer to do general anesthesia. This makes the operation easier for both the patient and the doctor.

Vaginoplasty is performed in a short time. After surgery, the patient returns to her daily life in a short time. The techniques to be applied in the operation vary depending on the patient's condition.

During the operation, no tissue is removed from the vagina. Therefore, no scarring occurs after the operation. During surgery, different methods can be applied depending on your doctor's preference. However, it is generally seen that sewing method is used.

The operation is completed by stitching the patient. The sutures used during vaginoplasty surgery disappear spontaneously. Therefore, it is not necessary to remove sutures or do any other procedure after the operation.

The operation is completed in 30 minutes on average. Although this process varies from person to person, situations where the operation time exceeds one hour is extremely rare. Due to the short duration of the operation, generally it is not necessary for the patient to stay in hospital. However, this situation may vary from person to person.

Things to consider after surgery

After the vaginoplasty operation, the surgical area should be kept clean and necessary care should be taken. Due to the stitching or similar procedures, movements that will force the area after the operation should be avoided. Two or three times a day, the surgical area should be cleaned with special products recommended by the doctor.

Recovery Process

After the operation, the patient can return to normal life within the first 2-3 days. In this process, personal hygiene should be well taken care of and doctor's recommendations should be followed.

It is normal to see a vaginal discharge in the first two weeks. If the operation area is cleaned regularly, the healing process continues without any problems.

In 2 to 4 weeks the effects of surgery begin to disappear rapidly. After the doctor's examination, the patient may begin to have more severe physical activity.

After the 1st month, many activities such as stretching exercises and weight lifting can be performed. If adequate improvement is achieved, the patient may return to normal life under the supervision of the doctor.

Sexual intercourse is not recommended for the first 6 weeks after surgery.
